perturbation.original_text:
This Gas Transportation Agreement (this “Agreement”) is hereby made and entered into on the 14th day of April, 2015 (the “Effective
Date”) by and between PennTex North Louisiana Operating, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“Transporter”), and MRD Operating LLC, a
Delaware limited liability company (“Customer”). Hereinafter, Transporter and Customer may sometimes be referred to collectively as the “Parties”
and individually as a “Party.”
perturbation.changed_text:
This Gas Transportation Agreement (this “Agreement”) is hereby made and entered into on the 14th day of April, 2015 (the “Effective
Date”) by and between PennTex North Louisiana Operating, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“Transporter”), and MRD Operating LLC, a
Delaware limited liability company (“Customer”). Hereinafter, Transporter and MRD Operating LLC may sometimes be referred to collectively as the “Business Partners”
and individually as a “Party.”
perturbation.explanation: In the original contract, 'Transporter' and 'Customer' are defined and collectively known as 'Parties'. Modifying the contract to sometimes refer to them as 'Business Partners' creates ambiguity. It becomes unclear whether 'Parties' and 'Business Partners' are interchangeable, potentially affecting the interpretation of obligations and rights throughout the contract. If these terms have conflicting obligations the enforcement of those obligations creates uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text:
For each Day during the Term, (i) Transporter agrees to provide Firm Service on the Transportation System for Customer
Gas delivered to the Transportation System in a quantity not to exceed Customer’s Firm Service Gas for such Day, and Interruptible Service for all
quantities in excess of Customer’s Firm Service Gas for such Day, and deliver to Customer, or for the account of Customer, at the applicable Points
of Delivery, Equivalent Quantities of Customer Gas received at the Points of Receipt, and (ii) Customer, or its designee, shall accept such Equivalent
Quantities of Customer Gas at the Points of Delivery.
perturbation.changed_text:
For each Day during the Term, (i) Transporter agrees to provide Preferred Service on the Transportation System for Customer
Gas delivered to the Transportation System in a quantity not to exceed Customer’s Firm Service Gas for such Day, and Interruptible Service for all
quantities in excess of Customer’s Firm Service Gas for such Day, and deliver to Customer, or for the account of Customer, at the applicable Points
of Delivery, Equivalent Quantities of Customer Gas received at the Points of Receipt, and (ii) Customer, or its designee, shall accept such Equivalent
Quantities of Customer Gas at the Points of Delivery.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines 'Firm Service'. Replacing 'Firm Service' with 'Preferred Service' introduces a contradiction. Since 'Preferred Service' is not defined, it is unclear if it carries the same obligations as 'Firm Service', potentially affecting the Customer's guaranteed access to transportation and priority during curtailments. This lack of clarity makes enforcement difficult.

perturbation.original_text:
Within fifteen (15) calendar Days following receipt of each of Transporter’s invoices and statements, Customer shall make
payment to Transporter of all undisputed amounts by wire transfer, in accordance with the account information provided to Customer, unless
another form of payment is agreed to in writing by the Parties. Should Customer fail to make payment in full of all undisputed amounts within such
time period, interest shall accrue on the unpaid balance at the Default Interest Rate or the maximum legal rate, whichever is the lesser, from the date
such payment is due until the same is paid. If Customer fails to pay Transporter undisputed amounts due hereunder and such failure is not cured
within ten (10) calendar Days’ of written notice from Transporter to Customer, Transporter may suspend receipt and delivery of Customer Gas
without prejudice to any other available remedies at law or in equity.
perturbation.changed_text:
Within fifteen (15) calendar Days following receipt of each of Transporter’s invoices and statements, Customer shall make
payment to Transporter of all undisputed amounts by wire transfer, in accordance with the account information provided to Customer, unless
another form of reimbursement is agreed to in writing by the Parties. Should Customer fail to make payment in full of all undisputed amounts within such
time period, interest shall accrue on the unpaid balance at the Default Interest Rate or the maximum legal rate, whichever is the lesser, from the date
such payment is due until the same is paid. If Customer fails to pay Transporter undisputed amounts due hereunder and such failure is not cured
within ten (10) calendar Days’ of written notice from Transporter to Customer, Transporter may suspend receipt and delivery of Customer Gas
without prejudice to any other available remedies at law or in equity.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stipulates 'payment'. Replacing 'payment' with 'reimbursement' without defining it introduces a subtle but significant contradiction. 'Payment' generally implies an obligation to pay for services rendered. 'Reimbursement' suggests a return of funds already expended, which could imply a different set of circumstances triggering the obligation. This shift in terminology creates uncertainty about the fundamental nature of the financial obligation, making enforcement ambiguous.
